definition[0]: an idea, method, or quality that is typical of a particular person or thing
example[0]: The explosion had all the hallmarks of a terrorist attack.
example[1]: Their performance did not bear the hallmark of European champions.
example[2]: These hotels still offer the sort of service which was the hallmark of the grand days of travel.
definition[1]: a mark put on silver, gold, or platinum that shows the quality of the metal, and where and when it was made
definition[2]: to put a hallmark on silver, gold, or platinum
definition[3]: a US company that makes greetings cards
definition[4]: an idea, quality, or skill that is typical of a particular person or thing
example[3]: Their ability to work under tight deadlines is a hallmark of their professionalism.
definition[5]: a mark put on an object made of silver, gold, or PLATINUM that shows the quality of the metal, and where and when it was made
definition[6]: to put a hallmark on silver, gold, or PLATINUM
